DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether Adductor-Canal-Blockade is effective at reducing morphine consumption and pain, and at the same time improving mobilisation after total knee arthroplasty.
DOC.brief_title: The Efficacy of Adductor-Canal-Blockade on Morphine Consumption, Pain and Mobilisation After Total Knee Arthroplasty
DOC.criteria: Total Knee Arthroplasty in spinal anaesthesia ASA 13 BMI 1840 Written informed consent Can not cooperate to the exam Do not speak or understand Danish Drug allergy Alcohol or drug abuse Daily consumption of strong opioids Unable to complete the Timed Up and Go test preoperatively
